thread.title: Hot-air balloons over Central Valley
thread.title_full: Hot-air balloons over Central Valley - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Christine Delsol
title: Hot-air balloons over Central Valley
text:
Photo: Color The Skies print_article_embed|photo-8455068|article-6456655|7 comments_jump_embed|photo-8455068|article-6456655|1 email_share_embed|photo-8455068|article-6456655|1 facebook_share_embed|photo-8455068|article-6456655|2 twitter_share_embed|photo-8455068|article-6456655|3 pinterest_share_embed|photo-8455068|article-6456655|4 reddit_share_embed|photo-8455068|article-6456655|5 google_share_embed|photo-8455068|article-6456655|6 Hot-air balloons Color the Skies in a benefit for local youth programs and Valley Children’s Hospital in the almond-growing town of Ripon. Hot-air balloons Color the Skies in a benefit for local youth...
OK, so it’s not Albuquerque, but the almond-growing burg of Ripon, between Modesto and Manteca, has been taking advantage of Central Valley thermals to put on an impressive hot-air balloon festival for nine years. The Color the Skies Hot Air Balloon and Kite Festival creates a celestial kaleidoscope accompanied by skydivers, jets and a medical transport helicopter team. On the ground, tethered balloon rides, a pancake breakfast, train rides and lots of kids’ activities are available. A carnival and live music extend festivities into the evening. Hot-air balloons Color the Skies in a benefit for local youth programs and Valley Children’s Hospital in the almond-growing town of Ripon.
